meanings.definition: To transport people or goods by boat or other means across a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The fishermen were ferrying their catch back to shore.
meanings.sent2: The ferrying of passengers across the river was smooth and efficient.
meanings.sent3: The ducks were ferrying their ducklings across the pond on tiny rafts.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like a boat ferrying joy across the sea of sadness.
meanings.sent5: The image of the ship ferrying supplies through the storm will stay with me forever.

meanings.definition: The act of transporting people or goods by boat or other means across a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The ferrying of goods across the lake was a vital part of the trade route.
meanings.sent2: We watched the ferrying of passengers from the dock with curiosity.
meanings.sent3: The little toy boat was in charge of ferrying the tiny plastic animals across the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: The concept of time seemed like a ferrying of moments from one shore to another.
meanings.sent5: The painting depicted the ferrying of souls across the river Styx in Greek mythology.
